intro: Sonchus vaginatus, commonly known as common sowthistle, is an annual herbaceous plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm and features alternate, heart-shaped leaves with a hairy surface. The plant produces yellow flowers in a composite head, followed by small, spiny achenes. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in fields, roadsides, and waste areas. Botanically, it is characterized by its basal rosette of leaves and a hollow stem with a distinctive leafy sheath at the base.
